block.p: Saying that George Steinbrenner had made a grave mistake by dismissing him as Hideki Irabu's translator last Friday, Kota Ishijima insisted yesterday that the Japanese pitcher would be lost without him next season.

''The fact that they fired me means they're sticking it in Irabu's face,'' Ishijima said. ''It's not a threat, but this is Steinbrenner telling him things aren't going to be the same and his privileges aren't going to be there. I talked to Hideki and he's wondering how he's going to get around without me.''

Saying that George Steinbrenner had made a grave mistake by dismissing him as Hideki Irabu's translator last Friday, Kota Ishijima insisted yesterday that the Japanese pitcher would be lost without him next season.

''The fact that they fired me means they're sticking it in Irabu's face,'' Ishijima said. ''It's not a threat, but this is Steinbrenner telling him things aren't going to be the same and his privileges aren't going to be there. I talked to Hideki and he's wondering how he's going to get around without me.''
Ishijima said Mark Newman, the vice president for player development, told him he had been dismissed for budgetary reasons. The Yankees said they are still deciding on a replacement.
